fields.description:
This is a proposal to add an ability to track milestones in issue tracker.\\
What I mean by that is for users to be able to do the following:

* See all milestones at a glance with the percentage of issues completed for each milestone. The percentage can be displayed as a progress bar with one side representing the % of resolved issues for the milestone and other for non-resolved issues.
* Open each milestone to see all its issues (which you already can do) but also to see the percentage of resolved vs non-resolved issues (which you can't now).
fields.summary: Track milestones (BB-5096)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create a new repository with a name ending "wiki". For example "repo-wiki"

Go to the wiki page https://bitbucket.org/<username>/repo-wiki/wiki/Home

Click the button which creates a new page ("New")

Enter any name for the new page, for example "new-page"

You will be redirected to page: https://bitbucket.org/<username>/repo-wiki/edit/new-page instead of https://bitbucket.org/<username>/repo-wiki/wiki/edit/new-page (which works fine)

Looks like /wiki/ will be left out if last four letters of the repository are "wiki".\\
Result: 404 error page is shown.
fields.summary: Cannot create new page in wiki when in a repo with wiki in the name from web interface. (BB-5152)

fields.description:
After the interface change, when I click on the compare link, both the outgoing and incoming tab displays outgoing changes. My team has recently started learning Mercurial and BitBucket, and they use the incoming tab to determine if they need to pull down the latest copy of code. They then copy the hg commands displayed. I'm afraid they are going to think they are up to date, and start creating merge conflicts between each other.

I have tried this on multiple repositories, and have the same issue with each one.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Compare fork displaying outgoing for both incoming and outgoing

This functionality would be very beneficial for third party developers consuming the API.

fields.description: I mostly authenticate via OpenID, and today I noticed that when using the URL http*s*://openid.example.com instead of my usual http://openid.example.com that BitBucket offered to sign me up for a new account. Shouldn't both URL's be considered the same user, and therefore both be automatically associated to one account? Right now I can have two accounts on BitBucket linked to the same OpenID account (one with http and the other with https).
fields.summary: OpenID, http vs. https distinction? (BB-5094)

fields.description:
Dear all,

Please try to do the following

1.) log in to www.bitbucket.org using the "log in"-button using the browser Epiphany. I used the version 2.30.6. Then close the browser window without logging out.

2.) Log in to www.bitbucket.org using the "log in"-button using Firefox 14.0.1 and then log out using the "Log out"-button in the drop-down list for your username.

3.) Open Epiphany again and begin typing in https://www.bitbucket.org . It should offer you an autocomplition for this. Accept the offer and load the site.

When I did this, I landed on my dashboard again. Why is that? By "logging in" using Firefox and logging out, I should have invalidated the cookies, I used during my "log in" using Epiphany. Therefore Epiphany should have taken me to the log in-site.
fields.summary: logout problem

With best regards:\\
Alexander Mostovenko

fields.description:
Previously, when the workflow controls were at the bottom of the form, you were able to add your own comments to the issue in the same action as changing the workflow (i.e. marking as resolved).

Since the UI update recently this is no longer possible.

Can it be made so that selecting a workflow action or clicking "resolve" will also submit take whatever is in the comment field and behave as it did before?

* Fill out the Title / description
* Accidentally press 'create pull request' button again instead of 'Send pull request'

Expected results:

fields.description:
What appears as "Status" in some parts of the UI is also referred to as "State" and "Workflow" in others.  This is pretty confusing.  "Assignee" and "Responsible" are less so, but the inconsistency is IMO unnecessary and best avoided.  [[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway's_law|Conway's Law]] at work?

"?" and "!" for type and priority in the issues list are a bit cryptic, as are the icons.

fields.description:
When a private repository is forked and the user removes inheriting access\\
management I only be notified when a fork is made, but I don't have access.\\
As an team owner I would like to know which of my team members did fork a\\
repository and always have access to it.

I would suggest for private repositories:

* The (root) owner of a repository stays admin of the forked repository.\\
Even if the checkbox to inherit is unchecked.

This may be different to public repositories

Also if I check No Public Forks, this should also be enabled on the forks\\
(without the option to enable public forks)
fields.summary: Add an option to allow the original owner of a repository admin access to all forks. (BB-5088)

fields.description:
After the update to the new issue tracker I have problems editing issues.\\
Procedure (works at least on issue BCLOUD-157 of repository dlopy/mvp):

* open the issue
* click on "Edit Issue"
* change the assignee to something else
* click on button "Update Issue"

At this point, the button turns grey and nothing happens. By bringing up the developer tools of the browser I was able to track the problem down to a "400 Bad Request" communication error with the server (see the attachment).

fields.description:
Currently, strikethrough is not supported in Markdown README files, or in wiki pages. This is for the obvious reason that the Markdown Syntax doesn't support strike through. (Personally, it's an annoying oversight.) Generally speaking, it's useful to be able to have a todo list, and "cross off" items as you work on them.

In other markdown enabled sites, <del> or <s> can be used. That's not possible, given Bitbucket's policy.

What I propose is extending Markdown's syntax slightly:

{{{

h1. Todo:
* Some Item
* Some Other Item
* ~Some Finished Item~\\
}}}

Using {{~}} as the character to represent strike through is used in other syntax, and I think would make a decent amount of sense. Since Bitbucket is built ontop of django, it should be possible to implement this as a template filter in a fairly straightforward manner. (I might even be able to submit an example one once work dies down a bit.)

It may seem like a small issue, but I've run into it enough that I felt it's worth devoting a ticket and some time towards. Let's hope the devs agree.
fields.summary: Support Strikethrough in Markdown README (BB-5048)

fields.description: Changing the password doesn't require the user also enter their old password. This means that it is possible to change someone's password if they happen to have left their BB account logged in without knowing their old password.
fields.summary: Password change doesn't require old password

fields.description:
Pull Requests are a great code review tool. On projects where code review is enforced for regulatory requirements (SOX, PCI etc...) it would be handy if the "master" branch would only accept modifications via pull requests and not pushes. This would enforce the code review process and provide evidence to the compliance officer of the regulatory requirements being met.

This would only apply to a single branch like "master" or configured branch, and users with write permissions can continue to push to other branches in the repository. This is a very basic form of Branch ACL (#3276) but with a narrow scope providing lots of value within the corporate environment.
fields.summary: Read only "Master" branch, everything has to be done through Pull Requests

fields.description:
Hey

We are about to import more then 200 externally hosted GIT repos into our BitBucket team account. There is only one thing that concerns us: the overview.

Currently we have no way of grouping repositories together. The frontpage overview just lists all our repos, meshed together. This makes it almost impossible for us to cleanly distinguish between our different projects.

Eg.: We maintain our own Drupal tree together with all submodules. This should be tagged as Drupal and we should be able to filter them.

Is there any outlook on implementing a better overview of repositories?

Kind regards,\\
Tim van der Linden
fields.summary: Account overview (BB-5049)

fields.description: The recent UI change removed comment numbers from issues. It is no longer possible to refer to comment #n.
fields.summary: Bring back comment numbers (BB-5026)

fields.description: Only the team itself and a single group gain permissions through inheritance.
fields.summary: Forked team repsoitories aren't inherting all permissions of the repository they are forked from (BB-5023)

fields.description:
=== To reproduce the bug:

h1. View an issue
h1. Scroll to bottom
h1. Type a long comment
h1. Reassign or close issue, or maybe change the priority...
... whoops!  you can't do that now!

When viewing an issue, I can comment on it or attach a file immediately, but what if I want to change the title, assignee, type, priority, or component?  Oh, wait, I think I see.  I have to click "edit issue," at the very top?  And then I can also comment on it there... but I can ONLY see the original title and description, and NOT any of the subsequent comments, including the comment I just made?!

Is this also a "fix" for something which confused people?  I admit, all those radio buttons were confusing.  The new set of drop-downs makes more sense--except the status drop-down--but I would suggest just put those drop-downs there from the get-go for anyone who has rights to edit the issue, without making the user click "Edit Issue" and hiding all the comments.

Regarding the status drop-down, I think "reopen" and "resolve" are confusing as separate buttons.  It would make a lot more sense to just put "open" and "resolved" in the drop-down.  I also don't think "workflow" is a good substitute for "status," which is the correct name for the field.  I recommend making "Status" an additional drop-down, like the other items, to the side of every issue, and allow the commenter to change them directly and submit them with the comment as described above.
fields.summary: New "edit issue" interface is unwieldy (BB-5002)

fields.description: With the new issue tracker redesign, comments on issues aren't generating notifications.
fields.summary: Comment notifications (BB-4997)

fields.description:

See [[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask|stackoverflow]] for a great example of a helpful, unobtrusive set of markup cheatsheets integrated right into the editor.
fields.summary: Link to markup cheat sheet (BB-5005)

fields.description: The title pretty much says it all.  That is a very useful button.  Users don't always find the "create issue" item in the "Issues" drop-down menu (there's nothing about that tab which indicates it _is_ a drop-down menu).

I have attached a screenshot of the problem, which should show better what I am trying to explain. I can supply a copy of the changeset, but it appears that I am only allowed one attachment and that there is a character limit to issue submission that is shorter than the changeset, so I can't insert it inline.

This occurs in both firefox 14 and chromium 18 on ubuntu 12.4. The problem could also be seen on my colleagues machine, running firefox on windows 7.

fields.description:
Hello Bitbucket team,

We've been having a major issue since we converted our account to a team account that we hadn't had before. It is consistently timing out on us when we go to push up our changesets. Some of our projects contain large files and this issue is crippling to us. We would use ssh which seams to work a bit better, but our office is mostly non technical people (artists), so even just setting this up is not really much of an option for us.

Is there a way we can set this up so https doesn't time out after a few minutes, maybe like an hour or two?

Thanks,\\
Four Story Creative
fields.summary: Bitbucket timing out consistently (BB-4985)

== current bug ==\\
=== link to a changeset generated ===\\
{{{\\
[[https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/changeset/hash|hash]]\\
}}}\\
=== in email notification with bug ===\\
the URL includes the pipe "|" and the following string "hash"

== to fix ==\\
=== link to a changeset to be generated ===\\
{{{\\
[[https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/changeset/hash | hash]]\\
}}}\\
with space beside (or at least before) the pipe

=== email notification to be ===\\
with correct, clickable link.

and more readable while editing, isn't it?

fields.description:
If I check the "//Inherit repository user/group permissions//" checkbox and fork a repository that has *only* the "//Administrator//" group with write access, the expected result is having the new repository also with *only* the "//Administrator//" group with access to it.

And what is happening today isn't that, as illustrated on the attached prints (order: bb1.png > bb2.png > bb3.png).
fields.summary: Forking Repo with "Inherit permissions" checked doesn't inherit groups permission properly (BB-5023)

fields.description: I imported a git repository called "MyRepo" but in bitbucket is named "myrepo" so when I deploy my application on linux machine the directory is called "myrepo" not "MyRepo".
fields.summary: Repository Name is case insensitive

fields.description:
There are a lot of spaces in tags <title> in atom feed like this: https://bitbucket.org/USERNAME/atom/feed?token=GUID

Microsoft Outlook doesn't show this feed correct.
fields.summary: Spaces in atom feed (BB-5082)

fields.description: See http://code.accursoft.com/binding/wiki/Home for an example; it resolves to http://code.accursoft.com/accursoft/binding/src/tip/binding-gtk/demo/lists.hs instead of http://code.accursoft.com/binding/src/tip/binding-gtk/demo/lists.hs.
fields.summary: URLs in wiki file links are broken (BB-4887)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
When I add a fifth element to the bitbucket.org/tymr account it turns the repository read-only. At the momment we only have 4 elements in tymr account. Can you please check whats wrong?
fields.summary: Repository Limits

fields.description:
When I update an issue or create one, i always get an email notification about changes done, though I don;t even have email notifications enabled in settings.

This is very annoying to delete all this messges from email inbox.
fields.summary: Don't send email notifications on issue updates to the author of updates

fields.description:
I just created a new team (well, converted to a team) and gave one of my members explicit 'admin' access to all repositories.

According to logic, the added member should have read/write access to all team repositories regardless of their public/private status. They are, after all, 'administrator' members.

However this is not the case. The member I explicitly gave admin rights to could see all private repositories but could not even read from them. Yet he could go in and change the public/private status at will, as well as perform all other administrative functions.

This is really bad design, and should be fixed. At the very least, team administrators should have a minimum of read access to private repositories but that somewhat defeats the purpose of the 'administrator' type.
fields.summary: Team Administrator don't have access to private repositories (BB-4888)

fields.description: I created repository (for git). Next I deleted the repository to create git repository with the same name (it was mistake, I had create git repository). Repository was not created. Now I see "Creating! Please wait a moment while we create your repository." for a very long time instead repository. https://bitbucket.org/Seinh/infinity-bytes-website (private)
fields.summary: Creating repository waits indefinitely

fields.description: I would like to be able to see how much storage each project is using on BitBucket
fields.summary: Storage

fields.description:
I haven't check if it's just me as administrator or everyone on my team, but I'm going to hear some screaming Monday morning if it's everyone and there's now way to turn this off on a per-repo basis...

Minimum is a way to turn on/off email notifications on a per repo basis (minimum to avoid screams - they'll all turn it off).

To actually be usable need to be able to check one or more of:

* send email when an Issue is assigned to me\\
** exclude changes made by me
* send when an Issue assigned to me is modified\\
** exclude changes made by me
* send changes to any Issue\\
** exclude changes made by me

and if none were checked no emails would be sent.
fields.summary: even if I uncheck "follow issue updates" I get a lot of email about every change to an issue…

fields.description:
if i try to create a repository with the same name as a repository i deleted a couple of days ago, it does not work.

it will not save the new repository, but also does not give any error message.
fields.summary: i cannot create a repository with the same name as a deleted repository

fields.description: some users are complaining about bitbucket issue changes generating too many emails.  Some way to control that on a per-user / per-repo basis would be very helpful.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Feature Request: control over email notifications for issues

fields.description:
When importing from an SVN with a privately signed key, I get the following message and the import fails.\\
Instead, it should prompt the user if he wants to allow access for the server or not.

23:15:53 svn import for: https://my_server.com/my_project\\
23:15:54 Checking out https://my_server.com/my_project...\\
23:15:55 svn: OPTIONS of 'https://my_server/my_project': Server certificate verification failed: certificate issued for a different hostname, issuer is not trusted (https://my_server.com)\\
23:15:55 Svn checkout failed: <class 'bitbucket.apps.async.tasks.ImportException'>: Command failed. Return value: 1
fields.summary: Import from HTTPS with privately signed key is not supported

fields.description:
Commit messages that include an issue number automatically have that issue number turned into a link to the issue.

However, the issue pages themselves have no indication that a commit is referring to them - ie. there's no traversal in the other direction, from issue to referring commit.

It would be ideal if there were a "Referring Commits" section added to the issue page, linking to the commits referring to that particular issue.

As it stands now, I manually paste the truncated commit hash into a comment to create a link from an issue to a related commit, but it would be nice if this were not necessary. It would be great to have a bi-directional linking relationship established solely from referencing the issue number in the commit message.
fields.summary: Issue page should list commits referring to it (BB-4864)

fields.description:
I have a repository there:

* https://bitbucket.org/aragost/kick-start/src

The {{{.hgsub}}} file declares three subrepos, all inside a {{{deps/}}} folder. There are no other tracked files inside {{{deps/}}}. Bitbucket fails to show {{{deps/}}} even though the subrepos ought to make it appear in the source page.
fields.summary: Subrepository links not shown if folder only contains subrepos (BB-4883)

fields.description:
If you go to a repository that contain subrepositories, such as

* https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-build/src

then you see nice links to the subrepos. The links to the subrepos themselves are fine, but the links to the changesets (the link in square brackets) has a doubled slashes:

* https://bitbucket.org/abderrahim/dulwich//changeset/71b73697d24b

Clicking the link gives a 404 error.

The spacing between subrepo name and the square brackets is also inconsistent: if the subrepo revision is not a link, the leading space is missing.
fields.summary: Subrepository changeset links are broken (BB-4882)

fields.description:
Commits are not closing an issue in a git repo from a commit using the syntax as provided here https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Up+the+Bitbucket+Issues+Service I encountered this bug on a private repo.

The issue number is linking to the issue in the commit list, but the issue is not being closed nor are the commit details being added as a comment on the issue. Tried several variatons of the provided syntax but none closed the issue.
fields.summary: Git Issue Broker

fields.description: I really love Bitbucket, but there is one major issue I'm having with the online website. You can browse the commit with a revision code, which isn't simply 1-6 but some annoying hash. I sometimes need to browse the code so I look at the commits screen, and have to manually copy that code, go to the source tab, paste that code so I can finally browse it. Can we please get a SOURCE link on the commit screen (overview + detailed view)?
fields.summary: Urgently needs a SOURCE link on the commit screen (BB-4863)

fields.description:
Hello!

I have repo with public issue tracker. Then I post a comment to issue - it can be mark as SPAM! I am the owner of repo and my comments - spam???\\
And my people try to post comments - they are also mark as spam. WTF?
fields.summary: Issues and comments to them mark as spam!
